item.title: Call of Duty is Getting a Street Fighter Crossover
item.content:encoded:
It has been revealed that Call of Duty is getting a crossover that wasnâ€™t on many prediction slates for 2025. On December 11, a Street Fighter collaboration is landing in Call of Duty Mobile, bringing four legendary characters from the fighting franchise into the first-person shooter world.

The Call of Duty x Street Fighter crossover will yield new Operators, a host of themed weapons linked to the Street Fighter universe, and more exclusive rewards for those participating in the event through December.

When Does Street Fighter Come to Call of Duty?

Call of Duty Mobile fans can take advantage of the Street Fighter crossover starting December 11, when the Heroâ€™s Collection Operator Series Armory opens up, officially introducing the Street Fighter characters to COD Mobile.

The lineup includes some of the most recognizable characters from the fighting gameâ€™s roster:

  • Ryu
  • Chun-Li
  • Akuma
  • Cammy

On December 13, the crossover will be expanded via the Championâ€™s Collection Weapon Series Armory, which introduces the unique weapon skins to bolster the collaboration.

Itâ€™s a bold crossover that nobody really anticipated, but itâ€™s a welcome one nonetheless. Call of Duty Mobile is, without a doubt, the most expansive and popular COD title ever made, and itâ€™s doing the live-service model perfectly compared to the annual releases of the core multiplayer shooters.

This collaboration heralds the gameâ€™s sixth anniversary, and itâ€™s the latest in a very long line of crossover events. In recent history, weâ€™ve seen the likes of Gundam, Nier, Rambo, and even sporting icons like Lionel Messi make their way into the Call of Duty Mobile universe.

Will you be participating in Call of Duty Mobileâ€™s Street Fighter crossover? Let us know what youâ€™re thinking on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Gentle Mates Beat OpTic Texas To Win Kaysanâ€™s $50k Tournament
item.content:encoded:
The all-new Gentle Mates CDL roster has stepped up and shocked the scene to secure a win in Kaysanâ€™s $50,000 Black Ops 7 tournament. The Kaysan Showdown VIII was the perfect opener for the Black Ops 7 season, pulling together four teams with unparalleled prospects for the upcoming year of competitive play.

It was FaZe Vegas, LA Thieves, OpTic Texas, and Gentle Mates that took to the stage, but when the dust settled, it was a surprise for many to see Gentle Mates standing with the trophy (virtually, of course).

An Unpredictable Season

On paper, nobody would have thought that Gentle Mates would beat the other three teams. Youâ€™ve got the back-to-back-to-back world champions in OpTic Texas, the cash-backed â€˜super teamâ€™ in LA Thieves, and FaZe Vegas, a new, rebranded roster with serious potential.

Gentle Mates unveiled its new roster just days ago, revealing the squad that will carry the hopes of the French organization through the 2026 CDL season. If Kaysanâ€™s tournament is anything to go by, those hopes are high.

The clips emerging from the tournament, which was an online event, were white-hot, showcasing a blistering Gentle Mates side that leaned heavily into the fast-flowing nature of Black Ops 7, which launched last month to a mixed reception at best.

Gentle Mates is going all in with this Call of Duty League roster through the 2026 season. Last year was a poor showing for the organization, which only just surfaced in the COD space after acquiring the LAG spot and rebranding for the impending season.

The new roster signing, a jersey refresh, and promoting some new sponsorships, like a clean Scuf controller variety, are all indications of Gentle Matesâ€™ investment in Call of Duty.

Did you check out Kaysanâ€™s $50k tournament? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server what you thought about the event.

For more Insider Gaming esports, check out the news that Team Liquid Brazil won the VALORANT Game Changers Championship

item.title: Team Liquid Brazil Claims Trophy at VALORANT Game Changers Championship
item.content:encoded:
The VALORANT Game Changers Championship, a massive $500,000 tournament, has wrapped in South Korea, leaving Team Liquid Brazil the victor over all comers. Ten of the best womenâ€™s and marginalized-gender teams came together in Seoul to fight for a considerable prize, and in the closing moments of the tournament, it all came down to two rival teams.

The Grand Final was a dramatic showdown between Team Liquid Brazil and Shopify Rebellion Gold, two of the most capable squads in the Game Changers scene. What unravelled was one hell of a VALORANT series.

Team Liquid Secures $180,000 in Seoul

Shopify Rebellion Gold broke into the Grand Final after a defiant lower-bracket run, meeting Team Liquid, the tournamentâ€™s dominant upper-bracket organisation sitting on a white-hot streak. The best-of-five final lived up to the expectations set by fans, with both sides trading maps as the series unravelled.

Shopify led the charge with an easy win on Haven, but the series was set to go the distance, and it went down to the wire on the final map.

Team Liquidâ€™s win denied Shopify a third consecutive Game Changers Championship win, and it was a redemption of sorts for the former team, having collapsed against Shopify during the 2023 Championship Final.

Beyond the Grand Final, the Game Changers tournament in Seoul represented the power of the Americas in the VALORANT space. MIBR GC and KRU Blaze brought up the rear, securing a third- and fourth-place finish, respectively, both of which hail from South America.

Team Liquid walks away from Seoul with the trophy and $180,000 in earnings, which is a nice payday after a hard-fought tournament.

Did you check out this yearâ€™s VALORANT Game Changers Championship? Let us know what you thought on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Turok Origins To Be Released in 2026, Dev Claims
item.content:encoded:
Turok Origins was given a short but sweet reveal trailer by Saber Interactive almost a year ago, and since then, things have run quiet. Weâ€™ve got a few details about the game, and fans of the title have busied themselves pulling every shred of information out of that trailer, but until now, Saber has remained mostly silent on the topic.

Recently, one developerâ€™s profile was uncovered on LinkedIn, bearing a clear indication that Turok Origins, which doesnâ€™t have a release window at present, will launch in 2026.

When is Turok Origins Coming Out?

If you head over to the Turok Origins website, youâ€™ll see that it can be wishlisted on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series XS, and Steam, but thereâ€™s no indication of a release window â€“ not even a year.

It has been a fair while since Turok Origins was revealed, and fans are wondering when this all-new dinosaur-slaying epic could drop.

It was recently discovered on a developerâ€™s LinkedIn profile that Turok Origins is â€˜forthcomingâ€™ in 2026:

The developer, a sound designer, also worked on Saberâ€™s Radikal Fighters and is supporting the development of an â€˜unannounced projectâ€™ at the studio.

Turok Origins is said to take players across various worlds as they explore a multitude of biomes throughout an immersive, â€˜epic storyâ€™ that can be experienced either alone or with friends. The game has a diverse array of weapons and abilities to uncover, and it can reportedly be digested from both a first- and third-person perspective.

Hereâ€™s the snapshot trailer, in case youâ€™re interested:

Does Turok Origins seem like your kind of game? Let us know if youâ€™re interested in Saber Interactiveâ€™s dino-packed adventure title on the Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: A Short In-Development Video of GTA 6 Has Surfaced Online
item.content:encoded:
A small yet highly credible video clip of GTA 6 has surfaced online. While it is from an in-development build, it does give fans an interesting insight as to how the game will look, gameplay-wise.

As one of 2026â€™s biggest upcoming games, Rockstarâ€™s Grand Theft Auto 6 has a lot riding on it. Through countless delays, fans have been eagerly anticipating driving and robbing the state of Leonida for almost 10 years. Unfortunately, the trailers have seemingly only shown cutscenes, with raw gameplay yet to be put on display. That is, however, until now, as a former Rockstar employeeâ€™s demo reel has surfaced featuring a small video snippet of potential gameplay from GTA 6.

Former Rockstar Employeeâ€™s Video Portfolio Includes GTA 6 Gameplay

Twitter user SynthPotato found the clip from a former Rockstar employeeâ€™s demo reel portfolio. The name of the employee was, of course, not disclosed. Still, the reel has several animations from other Rockstar games like Max Payne 3 and Red Dead Redemption 2, furthering its validity. From the looks of it, it seems the employee worked on a bit of GTA 6 prior to leaving.

As for what the clip is, itâ€™s not a lot. The video, available above, simply shows a character (unsure if NPC or player) dismounting from vehicles. While the first half shows a bike, the second has a render of Vice City, alongside what appears to be Lucia, one of GTA 6â€™s playable characters. It looks like it showcases how many ways the player character can dismount from a car, which is a rather neat detail.

Unfortunately, the video is all fans have to go off of for GTA 6â€™s gameplay. With the recent November 19th, 2026, delay, it may be some time before more is shown. However, if the level of detail for even the simplest of vehicle dismounts is any indication, it might be the most realistic entry yet.

What do you think of the GTA 6 video leak? Does it look better than you thought? Excited to see more? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more GTA 6, check out coverage on the ongoing legal battle at Rockstar and the last trailer. Make sure to subscribe to Insider Gamingâ€™s weekly newsletter!

item.title: Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1 Weaponsâ€”All New & Unvaulted Weapons
item.content:encoded:
A new Chapter has arrived in Fortnite with the launch of Chapter 7 Season 1, which brings the customary refresh of weapons and equipment found in the loot pool alongside it.

Fortnite Chapter 7 kicked off on the back of the huge Zero Point live event, attended by over 10 million players, which saw stars from the likes of Star Wars, Marvel, DC Comics, The Simpsons, and K-Pop Demon Hunters unite to fend off the Dark Presence.

Spring Break has now arrived in Fortnite as a result, and Insider Gaming has all the details on the new and unvaulted weapons in Chapter 7 Season 1.

All New Weapons & Equipment in Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1

There are eight new weapons and pieces of equipment added in Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1, including a new mobility itemâ€”Wingsuits.

The importance of Wingsuits early in the season is vital following the destruction of the Battle Bus, as surfing the waves onto the island provide limited landing spots. If you get your hands on a Wingsuit early, traversing the map becomes much easier and you can head to further locations to hunt for loot, where thereâ€™s likely to be less competition.

A full list of the new weapons and equipment found in Fortnite this season are below:

  • Iron Pump Shotgun
  • Twin Hammer Shotguns
  • Deadeye Assault Rifle
  • Holo Rush SMG
  • Vengeful Sniper Rifle
  • Arc-Lightning Gun
  • Forsaken Vow Blade
  • Wingsuit

All Unvaulted Weapons & Equipment in Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1

Five weapons have been unvaulted for Fortnite Chapter 7 Season 1, alongside the return of the All Terrain Kart and a host of healing items.

The likes of Chug Jugs, Shield Kegs, Med Kits, Bandages, and Shield Potions remain available, while players in Zero Build can continue to find Shield Bubble Jr and Port-a-Fort items to utilize.

On the weapon scene, the return of the Enforcer AR provides options from mid-to-long range, while thereâ€™s plenty of options for short-range combat with the Dual Micro SMGs and Tactical Pistol.

All the unvaulted weapons and equipment in Fortnite this season are below.

  • All Terrain Kart
  • Enforcer AR
  • Tactical Pistol
  • Dual Micro SMGs
  • Shockwave Grenades
  • Clinger Grenades
  • Chug Jugs
  • Shield Kegs
  • Med Kits
  • Bandages
  • Shield Potions
  • Mini Shield Potions
  • Shield Bubble Jr (Zero Build Only)
  • Port-a-Fort (Zero Build Only)

What is your favorite weapon to use so far in Fortnite Chapter 7? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Fortnite, find out where to find custom Battle Bus pieces, and check out the locations of all Pump Nâ€™ Run Gas Stations.
